intro: Talpinaria bivalvis, commonly known as the two-valved talpinaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-parted seed pods, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Talpinaria bivalvis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in specific garden conditions.
